The ruling was the latest in a series of closely divided decisions on elections that characterize the
work of the court led by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr., including
ones that have amplified the role of money in politics, made it easier to restrict voting and exempted
partisan gerrymandering from review in federal court.
